header.emu_comment: Low Res NX is a Virtual Game Console[CR]Imagine LowRes NX as a handheld game console with a d-pad, two action buttons and a little rubber keyboard below a slidable touchscreen. LowRes NX was inspired by real 8- and 16-bit systems and simulates chips for graphics, sound and I/O, which actually work like classic hardware. It supports hardware sprites as well as hardware parallax scrolling, and even offers vertical blank and raster interrupts to create authentic retro effects.

game.name: SX Library 1.0
game.plot: Sprite Expansion Library 1.0[CR]Created By nathanielbabiak[CR]**S** prite E **x** pansion Library[CR]This library will display filled polygons much faster than my other three full-screen display systems. It's blazing fast compared to the Pxl Library! And, if the game doesn't ultimately use all nine of the allocated sprites, the raster interrupt subprogram can be trimmed down to gain even more speed![CR]The technique works per row (raster scanline). It uses sprites N=1 to N=9 to display horizontal lines on the screen. Each sprite can be anywhere from 1 to 32 pixels wide, so to cover a whole row (of 160 pixels) it would use five sprites (5*32=160) of the nine available. A single row can be modified individually (it doesn't need to modify the surrounding rows above and below). The game will need to track which sprite numbers are used for which objects.[CR]`SXCLS` clears the whole screen of all lines. `SXCLS1` clears sprite number N on row PY. When lines (or objects) are moved left-right on the screen, you don't need to clear their old position first - just update the same sprite number N, and it'll move automatically. When moving up-down, you'll need to clear any old row(s) not required at the new row(s).[CR]`SXHORZ` draws a single horizontal line. It uses 1 to 5 sprites starting with sprite N. It uses as many sprites as required to draw the whole line. Since the game will track the number of sprites used for different objects, the `SXPAD#` options will force any small lines to clear additional sprites. (E.g., suppose you draw a short line that fits in a single sprite, but your game allocated five sprites for it, because sometimes the line might be drawn longer. You'd want to automatically clear the four remaining sprites rather than calculating the length of the line and clearing them manually.) The `PP` argument is palette from 0 to 7.[CR]The other drawing commands call `SXHORZ`, and will use the same settings.[CR]All other sprites (N=0 and N=10 to N=63) can be used by the game without being corrupted by this technique. The library also uses the left-most 16 characters of page 1 (a unique pattern allowing all the technique to work), and can only display that pattern's color. It's color 1 by default, but you can change it to color 2 or 3 for other games.[CR]Because of the nature of the technique, pixel-perfect collision testing with HIT or other methods is not possible without also being extremely slow.[CR]Outstanding Items:[CR] * Add additional raster subprograms when games don't need all nine sprites[CR] * Add clipping subprograms[CR] * Add additional technique that changes the polygon "layer" from solid to 50% transparent (relative to the BG0, BG1, and any other sprites)[CR][CR]Please comment if you want any of the outstanding items uploaded. (I haven't started them yet, as I don't currently need any of them for my own purposes.)

game.name: CHIP8
game.plot: CHIP8 Emulator[CR]Like 10[CR]Greenpilloz[CR]\- Nobody : [CR]\- Me : I'm gonna build an emulator for a fantasy console inside this emulator for a fantasy console ![CR]Bio:[CR]Created in 1977, CHIP-8 is the original fantasy console. Initially designed to ease game development for the COSMAC VIP kit computer, it has enjoyed several revivals over the decades for new and exciting platforms. Today, creating a CHIP-8 implementation is a rite of passage for anyone interested in learning about emulation.[CR](from https://chip-8.github.io/links/)[CR]Links:[CR]\- technical references: http://devernay.free.fr/hacks/chip8/C8TECH10.HTM[CR]\- Awesome CHIP-8: https://chip-8.github.io/links/[CR]\- online emulator: https://www.chip8.net[CR]Idea:[CR]So basically it is an emulation of a simplified CPU, with 16 Register (like variables), a stack (to save the location when jumping to subroutines), some other special registers to store a location (I), a timer (DT), and a timer for a buzzing sound (ST), as well as 4Kb of RAM where the program, font and sprites are loaded. Every address in the RAM is an address from $000 to $FFF (in hex), the program starts at $200 the fonts are at $000. Every instruction consists of 2 Bytes, so the program starts at instruction $200, then $202, $204 etc...[CR]Instructions:[CR]\- 00E0 - CLS[CR]\- 00EE - RET[CR]\- 0NNN - SYS ADDR[CR]\- 1NNN - JP ADDR[CR]\- 2NNN - CALL ADDR[CR]\- 3XKK - SE VX, BYTE[CR]\- 4XKK - SNE VX, BYTE[CR]\- 5XY0 - SE VX, VY[CR]\- 6XKK - LD VX, BYTE[CR]\- 7XKK - ADD VX, BYTE[CR]\- 8XY0 - LD VX, VY[CR]\- 8XY1 - OR VX, VY[CR]\- 8XY2 - AND VX, VY[CR]\- 8XY3 - XOR VX, VY[CR]\- 8XY4 - ADD VX, VY[CR]\- 8XY5 - SUB VX, VY[CR]\- 8XY6 - SHR VX {, VY}[CR]\- 8XY7 - SUBN VX, VY[CR]\- 8XYE - SHL VX {, VY}[CR]\- 9XY0 - SNE VX, VY[CR]\- ANNN - LD I, ADDR[CR]\- BNNN - JP V0, ADDR[CR]\- CXKK - RND VX, BYTE[CR]\- DXYN - DRW VX, VY, NIBBLE[CR]\- EX9E - SKP VX[CR]\- EXA1 - SKNP VX[CR]\- FX07 - LD VX, DT[CR]\- FX0A - LD VX, K[CR]\- FX15 - LD DT, VX[CR]\- FX18 - LD ST, VX[CR]\- FX1E - ADD I, VX[CR]\- FX29 - LD F, VX[CR]\- FX33 - LD B, VX[CR]\- FX55 - LD [I], VX[CR]\- FX65 - LD VX, [I][CR](see http://devernay.free.fr/hacks/chip8/C8TECH10.HTM for details)[CR]Keys:[CR]\- "123AZEQSDWXC" Correspond to the 16 keys "123456789ABCDEF" of the original console[CR]Special Keys:[CR]? -- Load from ROM[CR], -- Load from DISK.nx[CR]; -- Restart[CR]. -- Save to disk[CR]\+ -- Settings (change speed, key config...)[CR]H -- Help[CR]SPACE -- Do one step[CR]ENTER -- Run[CR]BCKSPCE -- Edit RAM[CR]P -- Play Mode (Run faster, don't print debug info)[CR]Comes with 23 preloaded games !!![CR](to load any other CHIP8 game you can use the following command in a unix terminal:[CR]c=0;for d in *.ch8; do echo "#$((c++)):$d"; hexdump -e '16/1 "%02x " "\n"' $d | tr -d ' ' | tr '[a-z]' '[A-Z]'; done >DISK.nx)

game.name: Touch Solitaire 2.1
game.plot: Solitaire (card game with touch control)[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]Plays much like simple Klondike Solitaire, with 4 sort piles for extra help...[CR]TOUCH DRAW:[CR]============[CR]TAP draw pile to auto draw a new card[CR](Unlimited drawing)[CR]TOUCH MOVE:[CR]============[CR]1) First, hold finger down on a card to move[CR]2) Then, drag finger to where you want to put the card[CR]3) Finally, lift finger up to attempt placement[CR](Only legal moves are allowed)[CR]TOUCH AUTO PLAY:[CR]=================[CR]If a card can be played on a goal stack, just TAP it [CR](If it is on the draw pile, first move it to a sort pile, then TAP)[CR]LAYOUT:[CR]=======[CR]DRAW pile is at the top left[CR]GOAL piles at the top right (ascending, start with aces)[CR]SORT piles are in between (cannot play sort to sort)[CR]BELOW, LEFT ARROWS: when empty, must play a king[CR]All below cards must play as in KLONDOKE SOLITAIRE...[CR]alternate descending red/black left to right.... (18 max per)[CR]HINTS AND TIPS[CR]===============[CR]The little white #'s tell you how many cards are in a stack[CR]There is the traditional winning screen you can watch...[CR]For a harder game, try not to use the SORT piles...[CR](It IS possible to still lose even if you use the sort piles)

game.name: Zone Editor
game.plot: Zone editor[CR]Created By Mrlegoboy[CR]Edit touch screen zones for use with timo’s infamous touch zone system.[CR]Uses file 8[CR]Hold a and:[CR]Left/right to change the total number of zones[CR]Up/down to edit a different zone[CR]Hold b and:[CR]Arrow buttons to change the size of the current zone[CR]Hold nothing and:[CR]Arrow buttons to move the current zone[CR]Press a and b at the same time to save to the disk/whatever your editing. (Note: was it a then b, or b then a? I cant remember, just do both to be sure.)[CR]I made my own version of the zone system, so im not actually sure how compatible this is. I might release a zone reader example if its requested.[CR][CR]The data format is this:[CR]First byte:total number of zones[CR]Then for each zone, 4 bytes:[CR]1:x position[CR]2:y position[CR]3:width (x)[CR]4:height (y)[CR]Note: if a zone is 2 blocks wide, the width value for that zone is 1 instead of 2. Same for height.

game.name: Epsilon 1.0
game.plot: Epsilon[CR]Created By nousername010[CR]The universe is impure.[CR]Purify it.[CR]\---[CR]Epsilon is a cell-based bullet hell where you're a defenseless ship that has to survive lasers, enemy fighters, and plasma bullets everywhere. Survive 30 seconds, and you can finally "purify" the sector.[CR]Each stage has a unique set of patterns, getting progressively harder than the last.[CR]Noticed problems:[CR]+Lag. I'm not too annoyed by it. It will either mess up your rhythm, or give you extra time to think out your next action, and I'm leaving it there for now because of the latter. Only occurs when all fighters, bullets, and lasers are on screen. That said, I'll do my best to reduce this occurrence with more compact subs.[CR]-CONTROLS-[CR]D-Pad/Touch - Move[CR]Up-Down/Left side tap - Select stage (on title screen)[CR]A /Right side tap - Confirm stage (on title screen)[CR]B - Move faster (On touchscreen, place your finger far.)[CR]Tips:[CR]-Trails left behind the bullet don't do any damage. They're there to confuse you. Same with lasers[CR]-Memorize the patterns.[CR]-Stay away from the corners.[CR]This version adds:[CR]+An ending[CR]+More patterns[CR]Will work on:[CR]-More attack patterns[CR]-Reduced lag[CR]Version history:[CR]0.6 - Fighter and more attack patterns, simplified bullets, secrets[CR]0.5 - Laser patterns, stage unlock system, fighters temporarily removed[CR]0.4 - Clearer laser warnings, stats recorded, better music.[CR]0.3 - Purification Possible, graphical improvements[CR]0.2 - Fighters and bullets, graphical and stage alterations[CR]0.1.1 - Touchscreen(qwaffe), movement limits, move faster[CR]0.1 - Concept

game.name: DashArenaV1-0
game.plot: Dash Arena[CR]Like 10[CR]nousername010[CR]Dash past enemies and swiftly annihilate them with your laser sword! Watch out though, for they are far too big to be dealt really close with. Some are even armed with guns that might shoot you![CR]\---[CR]Finally released! I might add more changes in the future, but they'll be minor. I have also given up on the gradual difficulty increase, since it's already as hard as is.[CR]This version adds the following:[CR]+Mines! Place them in places that are hard to reach.[CR]+Options screen[CR]+A clearer indication if you were hit and why.[CR]+Graphical improvements[CR]+Gameplay tweaks[CR]Controls:[CR]D-Pad: Movement[CR]A and B Buttons: Mines[CR]TIPS:[CR]-If enemies don't die in one strike, dash them again. Some have slightly higher health.[CR]-You can only slash in one dash so much. After a certain amount of attacks, you'll take damage from head-on collision with the enemy [CR]-You can increase the number of attacks per dash and other stats through pickups.[CR]-Attack enemies in a perpendicular manner if possible, especially the shooting ones. Otherwise, if they survive your dash, they might hit you again.[CR]-Pickups have a certain limit. Collecting that same pickup again once you reached that limit only increases your score.[CR]-Be aware of bullets.[CR]-Place mines in edges and corners.[CR]Things I'd like to add in the future:[CR]More clear SFX warnings[CR]Gameplay balance[CR]Bug fixes, a bit of polish and other ideas I might come up with.[CR]Version Summaries:[CR]0.6 - Shooting enemies, game timer element, new pickup, slight tweaks[CR]0.5 - Timer-based enemy generation, a bit more enemies, shields, pickups, slight tweaks[CR]0.4 - Minor yet important bug fixes, vertical enemies, slight tweaks[CR]0.3 - High score, basic functional combat, better music, slightly buggy.[CR]0.2 - Score, simple music, combat test.[CR]0.1 - Concept

game.name: Pxl BG Tool 1.0
game.plot: Pxl BG Tool 1.0[CR]Created By nathanielbabiak[CR]It will save ROMs (or load them) just like the LowRes NX BG Designer. It will allow you to create or modify backgrounds (which include pixel-level graphic windows) and Pxl Library metadata.[CR]There's also a whole bunch of additional explanation for how this whole thing works at the beginning of the source code.

game.name: Pxl Library 2.0
game.plot: Pxl Library 2.0[CR]Created By nathanielbabiak[CR]This upload is just all of the subprograms in one spot. As always, the default code can be used to experiment with different sizes and layouts of windows using the Pxl BG Tool.[CR]To reduce the learning curve, I've updated all my old Pxl Library 1.0 uploads for 2.0 with examples for each of these topics:[CR] * Graphics (https://lowresnx.inutilis.com/topic.php?id=800)[CR] * Picture Data (https://lowresnx.inutilis.com/topic.php?id=847)[CR] * Text (https://lowresnx.inutilis.com/topic.php?id=805)[CR] * Windows (https://lowresnx.inutilis.com/topic.php?id=806)[CR][CR]## Pxl Library 2.0 is Here![CR] * It pre-calculates all the addressing math and bitmasks into arrays (for runtime speed)[CR] * It allows custom character layouts (using the Pxl BG Tool)[CR] * It has simplified initialization (for token minimization)[CR] * It's optimized for LowRes NX's 1-clock-cycle cost of floating point operations (DDA algorithms from the 1960s are actually _slower_ in many instances due to initialization cost)[CR] * Its raster interrupt implementation is around 350 clock cycles faster than other implementations on this site[CR][CR]## Introduction[CR]I wrote Pxl Library 2.0 to be as accessible as possible, but it's still pretty complicated. In the source code there's a bunch of global variables defined at the top, then the pxl display initialization, then some ASCII art.[CR]You can delete everything inside the ASCII art and put your code there. To draw a pixel, use `PXL2_SETP( PX, PY, PC )`, which has arguments of the pixel coordinates (x, y) and pixel color (0 to 3).[CR]For other pxl-level commands, the arguments in each of the subprograms will give you a hint. `PX,PY` is integer pixel coordinates, `FX,FY` is floating point pixel coordinates. And to keep it easy, start with the `PXL2` subprograms, even though they're slower. (The `PXL` subprograms require slightly different arguments, boolean values, and it's really annoying to use them.)[CR]## Pxl System Initialization[CR]The first few subprograms (lines 35 to 122) are for initialization, just ignore them for now.[CR]## Display Commands `PXL_CLS` and `PXL_PALETTE`[CR]The (line 123) subprogram `PXL_CLS` is an extension of the LowRes NX command, and works for both 2 and 4 color pxl display. (The included display is a 4 color pxl display.)[CR]You can call (line 134) `PXL_PALETTE( RED, GREEN, BLUE )` only when using a 2 color pxl display, and it'll set the foreground pixel color for you. (The background color of the pxl display will be set to match the system background color.)[CR]## Drawing Commands `SET`, `TEST`, `VERT`, `HORZ`, `CIRC`, `CIRCFILL`, `LINE`, `TRIFAST`, and `TESSFAST`[CR]Starting on line 140, the `PXL` drawing subprograms are `SET` (meaning "set" a pixel to a certain color), `TEST` (to return a pixel's color), `VERT` and `HORZ` (for drawing straight lines), `CIRC` (for outline circles), `CIRCFILL` (for filled circles), `LINE` (which has a pair of X1,Y1 and X2,Y2 arguments for diagonal lines), `RECT` (for filled rectangles), `TRIFAST` (a triangle drawing routine that is "fast" because it isn't pixel-perfect), and `TESSFAST` (a tessellated triangle drawing routine for 3d polys, fast for the same reason).[CR]Note that `VERT`, `HORZ`, and `RECT` require the coordinate arguments to be sorted, i.e., `FY1<=FY2` and/or `FX1<=FX2` (sorting arguments is not required for `LINE`, `TRIFAST`, or `TESSFAST`).[CR]The suffix `CLIP` means a drawing command will automatically clip the border of the pxl window.[CR]Also, some subprograms have variations for `PX,PY` and `FX,FY`. The `PX,PY` variants are for (integer) pixel coordinates, whereas the `FX,FY` variants are for floating-point (non-integer) pixel coordinates. Rounding is built into the `FX,FY` variants, which will be super useful for 3D polys.[CR]### Image Commands `CELL`, `SPRITE`, `TEXT`, `PRINT`, and `ESCSEQ`[CR]These subprograms are extensions of LowRes NX.[CR]`PRINT`/`TEXT` are the basically same, except `PRINT` is slower, but automatically character-wraps and processes `CHR($10)` correctly. Don't use `CHR($10)` with `TEXT`.[CR]The meaning of `MODE` depends on whether you're using the 2-color or 4-color variant. For 2-color (`PXL_`):[CR] * 2 replace display (`SET`) with image[CR] * -2 replace display (`SET`) with image's negative (`NOT`)[CR] * 1 transparent-over display (`OR`)[CR] * -1 toggle-over display (`XOR`)[CR] * 0 take negative image (`NOT`) then mask-over display (`AND`)[CR] * ? any other value treated as 0[CR][CR]For 4-color (`PXL2_`):[CR] * 2 replace display (`SET`)[CR] * 1 transparent-over display[CR] * ? any other value treated as 1[CR][CR]`CELL` is limited to `PX` being a multiple of 8, and `PY` being a multiple of 2, it'll round to these multiples for you.[CR]`SPRITE` is much slower than `CELL`, but `PX` and `PY` can be any integer.[CR]The meaning of the `MODE` argument varies depending on whether you're using the 2-color or 4-color variant. For 2-color (`PXL_`):[CR] * 2 replace display (`SET`)[CR] * 1 transparent over display (`OR`)[CR] * -1 toggle over display (`XOR`)[CR] * 0 mask over display (`AND`)[CR] * ? any other value is treated as 0[CR] * the `USE_INV` argument will invert the bitmap (i.e., take the image's negative) before applying `MODE`[CR][CR]For 4-color (`PXL2_`):[CR] * 2 replace display[CR] * 1 transparent-over display[CR] * ? any other value treated as 1[CR][CR]`ESCSEQ` will process escape sequences in a string. It's not really part of Pxl Library - it works with any LowRes NX string commands. Lowercase encoding is automatic.[CR] * `\'` encodes `"`[CR] * `\+` toggles capitalization for all subsequent letters in the string (like caps lock key)[CR] * `\.` encodes new line (as `CHR(10)`)[CR] * `\\` encodes `\`[CR] * `\X` (where `X` is any letter A-Z) encodes that letter with capitalization toggled (like shift key)[CR][CR]### Image Commands `LOAD` and `SAVE`[CR]These commands grab a whole rectangular section of the screen and put it somewhere in working memory, but it's limited to `PX` being a multiple of 8 (no limit on `PY`).

game.name: Migration
game.plot: Migration[CR]Created By qwaffe[CR]A really nice abstract strategy board game[CR]Now detects wins, has sound and an AI[CR]Randomness is gone for now ):[CR]Mode selection: left for "easier" (I don't know how much easier), right (inverted) for hard (blocks moves much earlier)[CR]Someone told me the left one isn't that much easier, it just plays differently /: I think the left one is more fun to play with and draws more.[CR]Click the cocoon for a reset[CR]Rules from here[CR]Tap/click on the piece you want to move one space forward.[CR]First to have no moves left loses.[CR]Tap/click once after the game to reset[CR]Sorry for the frequent updates again. The AI now can't be defeated by pushing the center immediately (which made for easy wins.)[CR]Draws are now somewhat detected (if both of you don't have any moves after the move. this is not an official rule.) You only lose if you don't have any moves _after_ the opponent moves.[CR]The AI, even the hard one, is still easily beaten by early blocking

game.name: 8bit Solitaire
game.plot: Solitaire game [CR]Created By was8bit[CR]Much like regular Solitaire, with an addition of SORT piles... careful use of these will greatly increase your chance at a win :)[CR]If you win, you are rewarded with the "bouncy cards" ending :)[CR]For a "free style" version to practice on, see here: https://lowresnx.inutilis.com/topic.php?id=1448[CR]# CONTROLS:[CR]Hold A + arrows to align the GET pointer Hold B + arrows to align the PUT pointer Tap PAUSE to attempt moving a card[CR]# LAYOUT:[CR]DEAL DECK is at the top left corner PILES (top zone) are SORT and FINISH piles STACKS are below the top zone

game.name: 8bit Cards
game.plot: 8bit solitaire cards - BASIC CONTROLS[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]This will NOT focus on card rules, but will only focus on creating a system that controls the raw movement of cards...[CR]For a version that DOES use regular solitaire rules, with a suprise ending, see here: https://lowresnx.inutilis.com/topic.php?id=1450[CR]# CONTROLS:[CR]Hold A + arrows to align the GET pointer Hold B + arrows to align the PUT pointer Tap PAUSE to attempt moving a card[CR]# LAYOUT:[CR]DEAL DECK is at the top left corner PILES (top zone) are SORT and FINISH piles STACKS are below the top zone[CR]# CARD MOVEMENT[CR](G=Get pointer, P=Put pointer... then tap PAUSE) ..... DEAL a new card = place G P on deal deck ..... From DEAL to any PILE ..... From a SORT PILE to a FINISH pile ..... From DEAL or any PILE to any end or empty STACK ..... STACK to STACK, single or multiple cards ..... From any end of STACK to any PILE[CR]# MOVES NOT ALLOWED[CR]..... From SORT PILE to SORT PILE ..... From FINISH PILE to FINISH PILE ..... From FINISH PILE to SORT PILE ..... STACK TO STACK that exceeds table space

(move up/down to maximize your attack)[CR]... you cant lose this game (or win it) but you CAN lose your sanity... YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!

game.name: Sound Composer 1.5
game.plot: Sound Composer 1.5[CR]Created By Greenpilloz[CR]# Sound Composer 1.5 (maybe?)[CR]## Description[CR]I added a drawing tool to the track edit mode where you can set all notes and their attributes by drawing melodic lines. I guess it work best with a mouse (I haven't tried it on a phone). [CR]## How it works[CR] * In track edit mode you can click on a button at the top to switch between regular tracker and the new draw mode. [CR] * There you got a big black screen where you can draw the notes from left to right (note 0 to 31) and from bottom to top (pitch 0 to 96).[CR] * The top line presents some informations and controls:[CR] * Track number[CR] * Note[CR] * Sound[CR] * Volume[CR] * Sound command[CR] * Parameter[CR] * You can modify those parameters for the current note by clicking on them (see it as a "brush", if you set sound to 4 then all new notes will have the sound 4)[CR] * To quickly delete notes you can click below the bottom of the interactive screen. [CR] * If you click however on the dark gray line below then you just "paint" the note to whatever the current _Sound,Volume,Cmd..._ is set.[CR] * On the right side there are 4 dark gray lines for quickly editing all first, second, third and fourth notes of every beats.[CR][CR]## Changes[CR] * added better toggle switch [CR] * added scales:[CR][CR]By default the scale is chromatic (all notes) but if you click on the displayed note (e.g "C#6" OR "D-3") then you can change the current scale type (e.g "C# BLUES" or "D MAJOR"):[CR] * CHROMATIC[CR] * MAJOR[CR] * MIN PENTATONIC[CR] * BLUES[CR] * HARMONIC MINOR[CR][CR]It work like a brush (like for the other settings) so all new notes will be in the scale and if you click on the bottom gray line you can force existing note to land on the scale.[CR]## Credits[CR]Thanks to **was8bit** and **nathanielbabiak** for examples on how to draw individual pixels. Thanks **timo** for such a great console and tools, I hope I didn't put too much mess in the code. Also I kind of stole the idea from pico-8.

game.name: The Forgotten Treasure
game.plot: The forgotten treasure[CR]Like 11[CR]Jeanmilost[CR]The LowResNX is an excellent 8 bit console and I love it. As any excellent game console deserves to have good games, I wished to bring to it my modest contribution.[CR]The forgotten treasure is a small game in which you’re an adventurer, which heard about a fabulous treasure, hidden in the middle of a haunted place. Of course you’ll try your chance, but the deads will not let you quiet.[CR]The game offers 12 levels through whish you’ll to escape to many traps and dangers. If you successfully go through these hasardous places, and if you collect enough coins, you will be able to meet the treasure keeper, and perhaps he will let you escape with the treasure.[CR]The forgotten treasure proposes 12 levels containing many objects and monsters, and have 2 possible endings, depending on how many coins you collected.[CR]I developed this game in 5 months 😎 I hope you’ll enjoy it.

THEN you get 1 action that can affect the board:[CR]An Arrow Key will shift the board in one direction[CR]Button A skips and does nothing[CR]Button B will randomly choose an above action (inc. skip)[CR]By default, the computer will always win when: [CR]\- no one wins[CR]\- both you and computer gets 4 in a row[CR]\- computer gets 4 in a row, but you don't[CR]TO SCORE:[CR]\- you must get 4 in a row, AND...[CR]\- computer does not have 4 in a row[CR][CR]GOOD LUCK :)

I might make a few tweaks here and there but I doubts I’ll really make any big changes.[CR]Making a tool is fun and taught me a lot about how LowRes NX works so I nominate YOU to try and make your own tool! :)[CR]Update history:[CR]V0.1 - console-like interface, can run programs but can’t load nor save them[CR]V0.2 - can run programs from disk and save them[CR]V0.8 - UI set in place, has the framework for reading and writing programs but you still have to change the code to do it[CR]V0.9 - Able to read and save programs to disk, ASCII setting[CR]V1.0 - Cursor in editor and support for long programs

game.name: rttsapi
game.plot: API for Remjin Spyky Thyngy[CR]Created By Diamondwolf3393[CR]Use for building tools, games, and other software that involves speech synthesis. The screenshot is an example of what can be done with this.[CR][CR]~~~~~Manual~~~~~[CR]~How to Use~[CR]Write code in the designated area for your software. I would prefer it if you keep the copyright info and credit me when you release your software. To make the API speak, just write "CALL SAY(string to say)".[CR]~List of letter-phoneme associations~[CR]I will omit letters that make the sound you'd expect them to.[CR]A - Short A sound[CR]Ey - Long A sound[CR]C - Same as K[CR]E - Short E sound, Schwa sound, or short U sound[CR]Y - Long E sound[CR]I - Short I sound[CR]Ay - Long I sound[CR]O - Short O sound[CR]Ou - Long O sound[CR]U - Double O sound[CR]Q - K + W[CR]X - K + S[CR]Space - Space delay[CR]Double Space - Comma delay[CR]Triple Space - Period delay

game.name: Search and Rescue 2
game.plot: Search and Rescue game[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]GOAL[CR]======[CR]To find (and rescue) lost or hidden people[CR]HOW TO PLAY [CR]=============[CR]\- TAP any empty spot to search[CR]\- search is limited within 3 spaces (does not seach diagonally) [CR]\- anyone near will show a # of how far away [CR]\- does NOT indicate which direction[CR]GAME LAYOUT[CR]=============[CR]\- Top left #/# ... #Found/#ToFind[CR]\- Top right # = # of searches[CR]TO WIN, and GAME GOAL[CR]=====================[CR]\- Complete all levels (thats 45 rescues)[CR]\- LOWEST score wins[CR]\- at game end, rank is shown #1 is best[CR]HINT[CR]====[CR]Rescued people are NOT counted on subsequent searches

game.name: Tick Tock
game.plot: Tic Toc[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]Two prorgram are running simultaneously....[CR]DIGITAL: calculates time via synchronized timing at 60 frames per second... very precise...[CR]ANALOG: calulates time via virtual pendulum clock mechanics, and the math that controls the pendulum...[CR]WATCH and see how close they are :)[CR]... also, it can be relaxing to watch the pendulum... just don't blame me if you start uncontrollably quacking like a duck every time you hear the word "DONUTS" ;)

game.name: rtts1
game.plot: Remjin Spyky Thyngy[CR]Created By Diamondwolf3393[CR]A text-to-speech tool. For LowRes NX? Yes! It's quite the undertaking if I do say so myself. Use it for games that use speech, or any speaking needs. One small setback is that it has no text-to-phoneme converter, so you have to type the sound that you want it to make, and not the true spelling of the words.[CR]**DEMOS**[CR]LowRes NX:[CR]LOU RES EN EX[CR]Welcome:[CR]WELCEM[CR]Hello, world!:[CR]HELOU WERLD[CR][CR]Licensing info:[CR]You may freely use this software for any games or tools as long as you credit me.[CR]Copyright REMJIN 2016 - 2020

game.name: Bitmon 2
game.plot: Bitmon 2[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]...[CR]This is finished game...[CR]Learn how to make this game, step by step, here : https://lowresnx.inutilis.com/topic.php?id=1005[CR]Some things are different in this game from "pacman"...[CR] 1. Ghosts and Player have safety spaces [CR] 2. When player "dies" you won't respawn... play dead until ghosts leave[CR] 3. Ghosts move rather randomly but quickly[CR] 4. Eaten Ghosts roam randomly until they restore in their safety space[CR] 5. When all player lives are gone, use PAUSE button to restart a new game[CR] 6. There are only 5 levels, you cannot leave level 5 alive....

So far it’s just a golf game and that’s all it will ever be[CR]The original game idea was very weird it was gonna be a good game but instead of an golf club you had a spring onion and instead of a ball you had an onion hedgehog. game.name: Luck, Chance, or Fate 0.5
game.plot: Luck, Chance, or Fate[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]Now playable, but needs win detection,[CR]GAME PIECES[CR]=============[CR]... 5 types of regular pieces (12 each)[CR]... 8 special (gray in color)[CR]HOW TO MOVE PIECES:[CR]=======================[CR]1) TAP to set/unselect CURSOR[CR]2) find a matching piece that lines up with CURSOR[CR]3) tap or drag piece towards CURSOR[CR]SPECIAL PIECES[CR]==============[CR]1) Use to Swap places with any other piece[CR]2) Each one only gets up to 3 uses[CR]3) 3rd use = LOSE CARD[CR]TO LOSE GAME[CR]=============[CR]Game is over with 3 LOSE CARDS[CR]TO WIN GAME[CR]============[CR]1) Gather all like pieces together[CR]2) Connected pieces get checkmarked[CR]3) Special pieces need not connect[CR]... losing board shown...

game.name: Arkanoid
game.plot: LowResArka[CR]Created By Jeanmilost[CR]This is a small Arkanoid portage for the LowResNX.[CR]The game contains the 32 levels of the original version, and the final boss (20 hits are required to defeat him). The levels are arranged as close as possible as the original game, however there are notable differences because the original game allows until 15x15 blocks per level, whereas the current version allows only 6x5 blocks.[CR]I certify that the game may be completed, even if some level are very difficult (see e.g the level 12). My personal play time was about 1h30 to complete the game, but I think that it may be completed in 1 hour.[CR]There is no score in this version. I wanted to add a counter for points, but I couldn’t because I reached the number of tokens supported by the framework 😜 So I release the game as is.[CR]I hope you’ll enjoy it 😎

game.name: Zombie Shooter
game.plot: Zombie shooter[CR]Like 10[CR]Jonnywhateva[CR]Survive against waves of zombies! Progress to discover new weapons! Spend points to place traps and hold out as long as you can![CR]Controls:[CR]A: Shoot[CR]Hold B: Reload[CR]Double tap B: place traps[CR]Up/down: move[CR]Right/left: hold to switch weapons/traps[CR]Updates:[CR]Added bullet shell effect[CR]Added terrain; mud slows zombies, burial ground spawns more, grass no effect[CR]Other minor tweaks[CR]Update2:[CR]Added grenades and flamethrower[CR]Waves with increasing difficulty[CR]Zombie health[CR]Blood effect on hits[CR]Update3:[CR]Limited reloads[CR]Ammo pickups[CR]Backpack zombies (drop ammo)[CR]Graphical changes, not sure if improvement lol[CR]Multiple colors for zombies[CR]Game over is recognized by the game, not very flashy yet though. Just says game over and let's the game continue. [CR]Minor bug exists where shotgun might fire multiple times, still figuring out why. [CR]Update 4:[CR]Fixed the shotgun bug[CR]Update 5:[CR]Fixed bug that would sometimes skip waves[CR]Added minimum :D but it's just the smg with a different Sprite right now :([CR]Changed Sprite for smg [CR]Added kill count[CR]Started testing traps. Double press B to place a fan that slows down zombies.. kinda silly, but I couldn't think of anything else that would slow them down. [CR]Update 6:[CR]Added points counter[CR]Added fan, speaker, and land mine traps [CR]Fan: slows zombies[CR]Speaker: attracts zombies[CR]Land mine: explodes on contact with zombie[CR]Double tap B to enter trap placing mode[CR]Currently all traps cost 150 points and last 30 seconds before disappearing. [CR]Hold B to reload now [CR]Update 7:[CR]Hold to change weapons now[CR]Changed colors so the zombies don't make a rainbow lol[CR]Every weapon has its own Sprite and animation[CR]Weapons are unlocked as you progress, only get ammo for certain weapons each wave[CR]Terrain randomizes each wave[CR]Added a proper game over screen[CR]Land mines stay for 5 minutes instead of 30 seconds[CR]Some balancing tweaks and bug fixes[CR]Update 8[CR]Sounds and music![CR]Some balancing and bug fixes[CR]..I think I can call this game complete now.. and ideas or criticism are still welcome

game.name: Shuttle
game.plot: Shuttle[CR]Like 13[CR]TheLivingBlooper[CR]# Shuttle[CR]**1.0**[CR]A level-based space shooter. Throughout most levels, you unlock new shuttles that you can use in battle by defeating a boss. The boss will often be that shuttle, but not always. Bosses appear after a certain number of enemies are defeated. See if you can unlock all of the shuttles, and beat the game![CR] * Use `left` and `right` to scroll through your unlocked shuttles on the title screen.[CR] * Use `pause` to return to the title screen.[CR] * Press and hold `A` to shoot at enemies. This applies to all shuttles.[CR] * Press `B` as Strike to toggle invisibility. Only bosses can see you this way.[CR] * While invisible, your shuttle can't attack or be attacked.[CR] * Press and hold `B` as Scorpius to shoot using orbs.[CR] * Orbs shoot at a faster pace, but are less accurate.[CR] * Your health bar and cool-down indicator are shown at the bottom of the screen.[CR] * Power-ups will usually float towards you, with one exception.[CR] * The boss's health bar is shown at the top of the screen, if applicable.

game.name: Magic Square
game.plot: Magic Square game[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]Instructions inside...[CR]... see this for extra reading:[CR]https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magic_square[CR]THIS game uses an easy format of only using horizontal and vertical sums, it ignores diagonal and any other patterns of sums...[CR]TARGET MAGIC NUMBER is adjustable, but starts out with an easy and traditionally used number for this size ...[CR]GAME PICTURE shows one winning solution, there are many more... if you are not sure how to play, just copy and enter the shown solution and you should then understand how to play :)[CR]Explanation for the changing colors:[CR]1) INSIDE THE GRID:[CR]... since you may not repeat any #'s inside the grid, GREEN means no copies while PINK means the # is copied at least once or more times ... [CR]2) OUTSIDE THE GRID, along the right and below the grid:[CR]... these are the SUMS from the grid, and show GREEN if they match the TARGET MAGIC NUMBER, and show RED if they do not match TARGET...[CR]3) BACKGROUND will turn YELLOW and game stops if you have successfully created a magic square :)

game.name: Cash It
game.plot: CASH IT[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]PLAY THE CASH IT GAME! :) ..................................[CR]How much cash can you grab before time runs out?[CR]LAYOUT:[CR]========[CR]Top Left = Remaining time before game is over[CR]Top Right = CASH IT button[CR]Top Middle = Target Total[CR]Coins below = Coins to collect to add up to Target Total[CR]HOW TO PLAY:[CR]=============[CR]1) TAP coins below to select (green) or unselect (yellow) coins for their value[CR]2) The sum of all currently selected coins IS NOT SHOWN, you must add them[CR]3) Try to get as close as you can without going over the Target Total[CR]4) IF you are over, or are more than 100 short, you get NOTHING[CR]5) If you are less than 100 off without going over, you what you collected (selected)[CR]6) If you match the Target Total exactly, you get a +100 bonus :)[CR]7) Hit CASH IT when you are either ready to score your coins, and/or do another round[CR][CR]Beat my $7,026 ;)

game.plot: Big Text Game[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]A Word Seach without a dictionary... your honesty and spelling skills are assumed..[CR]INSTRUCTIONS:[CR]=============[CR]To Move Cursor: Arrow Keys[CR]To Scroll Letters: A-button + Arrow Keys[CR]To Score Letters: B-button + Arrow Keys[CR]Scoring notes:[CR]\--------------------[CR]1) Must be 3+ letters (green) in a straight line (not diagonal)[CR]2) All letters must be highlighed GREEN (not including the red cursor)[CR]3) Score=2^(letters-1) so score ranges from 4 to 512 each word[CR]HINTS:[CR]...............[CR]\- An easy mistake is to include the red cursor as part of your word[CR]\- to get a 10 letter word, move up/down to get last letter highlighted green[CR]No save or highscore... game is just to eleviate boredom in a productive maner ;)

game.plot: Terror 'n Taxes[CR]Created By nwallen[CR]Fight off waves of monsters, who drop coins. However the King still wants his taxes paid.[CR]CONTROLS: A - Fire arrow B- crouch to pick up the coins. The pick up happens on the upward movement. [CR]HOW TO PLAY: Kill enemies to get enough coins for when the tax collector arrives. When he does walk into him if you have enough cash to pay the taxes. If taxes are not paid the executioner comes. [CR]SCORE: Score is accumulated by killing enemies as well as paying more than required for the taxes.[CR]LAWS: extra tax laws are displayed at the bottom of the screen, the tax in increased when you break these.[CR]ENEMIES: Zombie (3 coins), Flying Imp (2 coins), Spider (2 coins), Maggot(2-5 coins)

game.name: Picture Picture Editor (Pro)
game.plot: Picture Picture... EDITOR (Pro)[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]THIS IS THE EDITOR... [CR].... the Displayer is here:[CR]https://lowresnx.inutilis.com/topic.php?id=855[CR]IMPORTANT: Install this program as a TOOL and use as a TOOL [CR][CR]This edits a 10x10, 7 color background display.[CR]LAYOUT[CR]=========[CR]Top left is your actual finished display: TAP to select a cell[CR]Top right is your cell editor: TOUCH to edit[CR]Bottom right is your color selector: TOUCH to select a color[CR]Above the colors are the EDIT commands[CR]Bottom left is your data storage controls[CR]DATA STORAGE[CR]=============[CR]**SAVE to PERSIST first (and before you exit)[CR]**LOAD from an empty PERSIST causes errors[CR]... load as soon as you run this and want to reload previous save[CR]WRITE to disk stores to a temp disk file first[CR]READ from an empty disk causes errors[CR]** obsolete when Editor is used as a tool,[CR]... useful only when Editor is used manually...[CR]EDIT commands[CR]========================[CR]GET: stores selected cell image in GETPUT memory[CR]PUT: pastes into selected cell from GETPUT memory[CR]? SPECIAL: rotates and flips selected cell image[CR].... tap several times to see the different options..[CR].... double beep means its back to the original image

game.name: Computer Quad Core
game.plot: Computer Quad Core (puzzle game)[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]... your new QUAD CORE computer processor keeps crashing... can u fix it?[CR]HOW TO PLAY[CR]============[CR]ARROW KEYS = move controller[CR]TAP (A) = swap #'s in the controller[CR]HOLD (B) = place #'s in the controller[CR]*note* controller does NOT flip around (reorient)[CR]GOAL [CR]========[CR]\- remove white #'s by lining up 3 same numbers in a row or column[CR]\- remove all nearby white #'s with data erasers[CR]\- removing ALL white #'s wins the game[CR]\- ( controller entry and what it carries will be random )[CR]LAYOUT[CR]========[CR]\- Overall view is of the computer data core.[CR]\- There are 4 data gates that allow your controller to enter[CR]\- Total time = upper left[CR]\- Total number of white #'s = upper right

game.name: Get the Gold!
game.plot: Get the Gold (game)[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]You and the computer both have a pile of gold coins, and are rolling dice to try to get each other's gold![CR]HOW TO PLAY[CR]============[CR]BEGIN GAME: [CR]TAP screen at game title to start game[CR]NEW ROUND OF PLAY:[CR]1) TAP the screen[CR]... both players put a gold coin up in the "pot"[CR]... dice begin to roll...[CR]2) ... after dice have all been rolled, you may time to "cheat" and TAP one or two of your dice to reroll something better... HURRY as the computer will score the dice very quickly.[CR]3) After the rolls have been assessed, a code is shown in the middle of the screen...[CR]?? = no winner, pot gets bigger...[CR]P< = player wins pot[CR]>C = computet wins pot[CR].... end of round, begin new round of play (step 1)

[CR]This is a demonstration showing how:[CR]DATA, GAME MAP, enemies, items, etc. are ...[CR]\- PLAYED on BG 0 from ACTIVE memory[CR]\- SAVED to and RESTORED from PERSIST to ACTIVE memory[CR](Special game data stored/retrieved from top line of active memory)[CR]===========================================[CR]TO PLAY THIS DEMO GAME....[CR]L/R to move left/right[CR]U/D to move up/down the tubes[CR]B to jump[CR]A to pick up[CR]To kill enemies, jump and land on their heads[CR]To pick up upgrades / items, move over them and press A

game.plot: Testing PERSISTENT MEMORY[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]A very simple test of persistent memory...[CR]What you see is a small mini map of a big map... the big map holds 16 mini maps... each mini map has an x,y spot on the big map...[CR]00 10 20 30[CR]01 11 21 31[CR]02 12 22 32[CR]03 13 23 33[CR]Arrow keys help your little character to explore the maps...[CR]There are 3 items you may pick up, move, and drop in any grassy spot... a KEY, a HEART, and a BOTTLE[CR]TO PICK UP: move on top of the item... and press the (A) button [CR]TO DROP: move onto empty grass... and press the (B) button[CR]You may only hold 1 item at a time.. it is shown under the mini map location[CR]IF you exit the game before dropping an item off, you forever lose that item[CR]You may move to any other mini map to drop off an item, you dont have to stay on the same mini map[CR]You may exit the game anytime... when you run the game again, you will find the items stay where you moved them to ;)[CR]V02.01 has better map making, but has errors...

game.name: Brainfuck
game.plot: Brainf**k interperter[CR]Created By LowRes Oranges are good[CR]Thank you to was8bit for helping me figure out how to upload programs![CR][CR]So brainf**k is a super simple programming language with only 8 COMMANDS[CR]That's microscopic compared to lowres nx. Which is why it's really easy to make a interpreter for. (By the way, I did not create the actual language. I just made the program for it!) Here are the 8 commands:[CR]\+ adds 1 to current cell[CR]\- subtracts 1 from current cell[CR]> moves to next cell[CR]< moves to previous cell[CR]. Outputs acii value of current cell[CR], takes one letter input stores acii value of input in current cell[CR]( start of loop[CR]) end of loop[CR](Loops EXIT if the value of current cell=0)[CR]Enjoy! 🙂🙂🙂🙂

game.name: Natac Island 1.7b
game.plot: Natac Island [CR]Created By was8bit[CR]Version 1.0 Fully Playable[CR].... needs to have WIN scenarios added...[CR]1.7 robber and events work now..[CR]1.7b deworked game goals set...[CR][CR]LAYOUT:[CR]=======[CR]TOP section show what resources you have and can use[CR]GREEN section is the game MAP[CR]BLUE section is the ACTION pad[CR]WIN DATA section is above the map in white text[CR]WIN DATA[CR]========[CR]\- LEFT shows win goal code[CR]\- MIDDLE # shows min score needed[CR]\- RIGHT #'s show goal #'s[CR][CR]ACTION PAD[CR]==========[CR]There are 4 mode buttons at top: MOVE, FARM, MAKE, BUILD[CR]You match 3 identical things to do that thing... [CR]FIRST: start by touching a tile you want[CR]SECOND: slide your finger to nearby matches[CR]THIRD: upon your third identical match, it does the action[CR]... matches may be orthogonal (easy) and or diagonal (hard)[CR]MOVE mode will move the highlight over on the green map... this is where things will happen (like build or farm)[CR]FARM mode (if highlighted on one of your buildings) will let you gather resources from nearby farms[CR]MAKE mode makes roads and buildings (from your farm resources) to be built later[CR]BUILD mode will build roads or a village or build upgrades[CR]TRADE[CR]======[CR]Sometimes you can't farm what you need... you can TRADE at a ratio of 10 resources for 1 needed resource.. here's how...[CR]\- TAP the orange double-arrow 10 - 1 button at the top right[CR]\- Then, resources that you have +10 are green on the left, TAP one[CR]\- Then, on the right, TAP the resource you need 1 of[CR]\- FINALLY, TAP the OK button to do the trade[CR]\- TAP "NO" to exit without trading[CR]... if you don't follow all of these rules, trading won't occur...[CR]HAZZARDS[CR]=========[CR]ROBBER may steal farming resources[CR]EVENTS may destroy built buildings or roads[CR]GAME RULES, CHARTS, and other stuff are added at the top of the written game code

game.name: Design Art
game.plot: Designer Art 1.0[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]Create your own art... find your muse....[CR]*BONUS* you are free to redesign the stamps and even create your own font set if you want to... just leave my name in the code, and add your name for any changes you make :)[CR]FEATURES:[CR]=================[CR]110 Stamp designs[CR]24 Shades of ink[CR]2 layers[CR]Auto-Saves to “file” so you can close the app and come back later to work on it some more[CR][CR]MAIN TOOLS:[CR]===========[CR]Stamp Selection: on the left side is a selection of stamps... the stamp icon shows which design is selected... the section shown is just one of several available sets.[CR]Palette Selection: on the upper right is a selection of color palettes... the brush icon shows the color from which palette that is selected... there are 3 available colors for each palette.[CR][CR]SPECIAL SETTINGS:[CR]=================[CR]On the lower left are 4 special settings...[CR]Color shade Selection: the icon is a loopy arrow and a brush... this lets you select one of the 3 available colors from the palette you selected above [CR]Stamp SET Selection: the icon is a loopy arrow and a stamp... there are 4 different sets to choose from. The first set has the “eraser” which is basically just a blank stamp. The 4th set is a special alpha-numeric set described below...[CR]“Background to draw on” Selection... the icon is up/down arrows and a brush... this sets which layer you will draw on... up arrow is the above layer, down arrow is the below layer[CR]“Backgrounds you can see” Selection... the icon is up/down arrows with an eye... this simply lets you choose which backgrounds you can see and which background to hide[CR]SUPER SECRET [CR]=============[CR]The 4th stamp set includes all the normal letters numbers and symbols NX offers... to access most of them, toggle the Color shade Selection... all of these are one shade, but the other characters are stored this way... and there is a secret set of symbols that you can’t get thru Color shade Selection, to get this secret set - hit the little dot ...

game.name: Bitbytes
game.plot: Bitbyts Dine[CR]Created By was8bit[CR](Upon 3 likes I’ll make version 2 that will add some AI that changes gameplay based on time of day, etc..)[CR]INTRO:[CR]======[CR]Welcome to was8bit's BITBYTS DINE where the tired little data bits on your device can come and grab a byte to eat when they get hungry (or their energy level goes down to zero) ;)[CR]You own my franchise, and are trying to help make hungry Bits happy and full, while also trying not to lose money... you owe $1000 for purchasing this franchise, can you turn your debt into profit???[CR]RULES: [CR]======[CR]1) Empty tables that are clean and set to serve customers appear empty with 4 menus placed in the center of the table[CR]2) When hungry Bits first sit down at a table they will appear as empty circles .. they are waiting for you to take their orders...[CR]3) HOLD your finger on that table... in time the empty circles turn into half filled circles... now the Bits have ordered, but they still need their food[CR]4) Continue to HOLD your finger on their table until the circles turn solid... now the Bits have their food and will enjoy eating their food[CR]::: while holding your finger down they will talk (grumbly sound) but when the grumbly noise stops, this lets you know they are now eating and you can remove your finger.[CR]5) When the Bits are done, they will pay their bill and leave... they also leave a mess on the table.. keep tapping on the messy table until it appears completely free of debris[CR]::: when tapping you will hear a soft tap sound. When the table is clean you will hear a one time snap sound letting you know the table is all clean.[CR]6) You must now wait until your employees reset the clean table before it will be ready for more hungry Bits...[CR]NOTES:[CR]=======[CR]\- if you take too long to respond to Bits before they get their food, they may just decide to leave... that's money lost!!![CR]\- if you accidentally tap a READY TABLE you will put it on RESERVE which means Bits can't eat at that table... it takes time for a reserved table to become available again[CR]\- TIME IS MONEY, so you'll notice that as time passes bills keep slowly piling up... you need to make your money faster than the bills to turn your overall debt (red) into profit (black)[CR]\- Total bills are shown at the top middle as red (money going out)[CR]\- Total payments from Bits are shown at the top left as green (money coming in)[CR]\- Profit or Loss of your company is shown at the top right

How many can you get?[CR]TIPS[CR]=============[CR]TAP the screen to get the OneBits attention [CR]WHERE you tap affects their jumping and where they will jump... [CR]TAP the top of the screen to release the OneBits to their normal behavior

game.name: Fizz Buzz
game.plot: Fizz Buzz[CR]Created By dredds[CR]A little arcade/puzzle game I originally wrote to demonstrate how to use animation paths in a game. It turned out to better than I’d expected so I polished it up.[CR]Tap to pop the bubbles in increasing order, starting at 1, then 2, 3, 4, ... But the rules of Fizz Buzz apply. If the number is a multiple of 3, tap Fizz instead of the number. If the number is a multiple of 5, tap Buzz. If the number is a multiple of 3 _and_ 5, tap Fizz then Buzz.[CR]Time is ticking. Every incorrect tap loses a bit more time. Every correct tap gives you a bit more time.[CR]Can you pop the 99’th bubble?

game.name: Thunderation (2)
game.plot: Thunderation game[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]Built from Map Scrolling by TIMO[CR]https://lowresnx.inutilis.com/topic.php?id=318[CR]Title music by DJMoffinz[CR]GOALS: [CR]1) To remove bricks to reveal coins[CR]2) To collect coins to get upgrade pickups[CR]3) To remove all blobs to open up the exits[CR]STATUS BAR:[CR]Stays up top to show your game stats..[CR]1) Coins = every 100 you get pickups: a heart + another upgrade[CR]2) Aliens = # of remaining aliens in a section[CR]3) Heart = number of player lives (0=game over)[CR]4) Speedy Shoes = higher # is faster[CR]5) Bombs: red # = # that can be dropped at one time[CR]... dark yellow # = # that have been dropped[CR]6) Fireball = how far a bomb blast travels[CR]TO SET A BOMB:[CR]1) place yourself where you would like the bomb to be placed[CR]2) hit the (A) button to toggle between ready-to-set-bomb or walking mode[CR].... choose the mode where you are holding the bomb...[CR]3) now, move away from the bomb to leave it and activate it... [CR]TO KICK A BOMB:[CR]1) activate a bomb[CR]2) quickly bump into it[CR]3) a moving bomb won’t explode until it hits something[CR]TO USE SPEEDY SHOES:[CR]1) hold down the (B) button[CR]2) move in any direction[CR]3) release the (B) button for slower more precise walking [CR]TIPS:[CR]1) Before leaving a section, be sure to remove all bricks so as to be able to get as many upgrades as you can .. you cannot go back to previous sections...[CR]2) Be careful around blobs, they can move quickly and unexpectedly[CR]3) Be careful of your bomb blasts, they can fry you![CR]4) When planting a bomb beside a blob, be careful not to bump into the blob[CR]5) Coins block blobs, you can leave a coin if it helps limit a blob’s movement[CR]Read comments below for more game tips :)

game.name: Path Editor 1.0.3
game.plot: Path editor[CR]Like 10[CR]dredds[CR]An editor for animations paths.[CR]A path is a sequence of cubic Bezier spline curves. The data format and editor ensures that segments join smoothly.[CR]Paths can be interpolated directly from ROM. They don’t need to be loaded into BASIC arrays first.[CR]UI features that are not immediately obvious:[CR] * you can hide/restore the GUI buttons by tapping on the background[CR] * you can change the file comment in the save dialog by tapping the comment text

game.name: Medieval Checkers 1.0
game.plot: Medieval Checkers game[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]Similar to the game STRATEGO, try to defeat all 3 enemy kingdoms before they destroy you![CR]GAME RULES:[CR]=============[CR]> Each player takes their turn moving one moveable piece up, down, left, right either onto empty land or to attack an enemy piece[CR]> A player is defeated and all their pieces removed from the board if their castle is attacked by ANY moveable enemy piece[CR]> When a piece attempts to move onto a space occupied by an enemy piece, they are attacking that piece.... the results follow the PIECE RULES below...[CR][CR]PIECE RULES:[CR]=============[CR]CASTLE / BOMB....[CR]> The castle and the bomb cannot be moved...[CR]> CASTLE: if any enemy makes a move on the castle, the owner of the castle is defeated and removed from the game[CR]> FIRE BOMB: if any enemy makes a move on the bomb, the bomb blows up and the bomb and the attacking enemy are removed from the game[CR]ALL OTHER PIECES ...[CR]> General rule for all movable pieces: if you attack an identical enemy piece (ex. Your spy makes a move on an enemy spy) BOTH pieces get removed from the board... for all other matchups, read below....[CR]> SPY: can only attack and defeat the SWORD, any moveable piece (except sword) can defeat the spy[CR]> SPEAR,AXE,SWORD: each have little dots indicating values 1,2,3 .. if these pair up the higher value weapon wins... any of these pieces defeat Spy and BowArrow (except sword cannot defeat spy)[CR]> The BOW AND ARROW is a stealthy attacker and when it strikes first it will defeat any enemy piece (except the bomb)... however, when attacked, ANY moveable enemy piece can defeat it...

game.name: Pac Dug 2.2
game.plot: Pac Dug game[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]Eat your way thru the dirt to find buried treasure.[CR]Once you found over 100 treasure points for that round, an exit door appears which leads to another round... each round adds more treasure but also more ghosts.[CR]Treasure points get bigger for each new treasure you find... the next treasure always yields much more points than the last one, so if you can wait before exiting you can rally get a lot of points.[CR]BUT, once ghosts hit your trail, they become more aggressive and chase you, so be careful! When a ghosts eats you the game immediately ends![CR]Hint: you can also score points eating the BIG ghosts before they can eat you! Create looped pathways, they may detour away from you![CR](Upgrade made pacman and ghosts faster, upgraded sound effects)

game.plot: Avalanche game[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]Loosely based on the board game of the same name..[CR]https://www.geekyhobbies.com/avalanche-board-game-review/[CR]WIN: Fill all of your BOARDS and get rid of all unneeded WON MARBLES[CR]POOL: These marbles are available for PLAY by either player[CR]BOARDS: These must be filled in from your WON MARBLES[CR]WON MARBLES: These are all the marbles you've won from PLAY[CR]PLAY: You start your turn choosing a PLAY marble from either the POOL or from anyone's WON MARBLES. Then you choose which hole at top to put your marble in. All marbles that fall out the bottom become your WON MARBLES, whether you need them or not.[CR](Still needs an end game check for a winner, but otherwise is playable...)

game.name: Infiltrator
game.plot: Infiltrator 2000[CR]Like 12[CR]dredds[CR]A shoot ‘em up inspired by 80s classics like Xevious and Uridium.[CR]## Strategy guide[CR]Don’t stay still, don’t linger near the edge of the screen and don’t let too many enemies get on screen at once. And unless you’re trying for a high score, hold down the fire button and don’t let go![CR]**Spoiler warning!** Don’t read any further if you want to discover the game for yourself.[CR]Spinning discs: Fly straight down the screen at you. Shoot them or avoid them. Not very dangerous.[CR]Diagonal crosses: fly across the screen shooting diagonally. They don’t shoot at you directly but if you let too many of them stay onscreen you’ll become boxed in by their shots.[CR]Thin cigar-shaped nasties: Fly straight down the screen swerving left and right to avoid your shots. When out of sight, they turn around and come back at high speed to try and hit you from behind. Shoot them before they go offscreen, or keep moving so they miss you on the way back.[CR]Square flippers: move straight down the screen. Your blasters merely knock them back, but if you manage to knock one off the top of the screen it won’t return.[CR]Small diamonds: home in on you, but quite slowly. If they come close behind you, fly up and around them into a position where you can take them out with your blasters.[CR]Rings: move horizontally in front of you, firing at your current position. Keep moving and don’t allow too many on screen at once or you’ll get boxed in by their shots.[CR]Fat hemispheres with a flashing light: cross the screen laying small mines. Hitting a mine will kill you. Some time after being laid, a mine will explode, shooting fireballs in random directions. Destroy mines with your blasters. But beware: their small size means they’re hard to hit.[CR]Robot leader: we have no intelligence about the robot leader. You’ll have to improvise tactics when you get there.[CR]Scoring: you are rewarded for accuracy so if trying for a high score, don’t spray fire willy-nilly.

game.name: Bugzy Battle Game 3.0
game.plot: Bugzy Battle Game[CR]Created By was8bit[CR]OK, you are sent to remove a "SPACE BUG" infestation... there are 3 different types of bugs[CR]1) Y shaped are slow and just get in the way, they don't even harm you[CR]2) Double winged V shaped are QUEENS and can start new NESTS.. they can fire bullets at you [CR]3) Blocky U shaped are SOLDIERS and will RAM you, killing you. They are FAST!![CR]You have 2 different types of Fire-power...[CR]1) HEAVY fire is available with the (A) button, and shoots slowly forward... it takes out all bugs and helps bust up NESTS[CR]2) LIGHT RAPID fire is available with the ( B) button, and it shoots backwards (rearward) - so when the SOLDIER BUGS are chasing you, you can run away from them and still kill them while they are behind you ;) Does not affect nests.[CR]NESTS: give birth continuously to new bugs. As you attempt to destroy them, the nest can be rebuilt over time. Once one nest is destoyed, any QUEEN of that color may start a new nest. Nests and bugs come in three colors and types:[CR]1) RED: Very aggressive, hard to kill off[CR]2) YELLOW: somewhat aggressive[CR]3) GREEN: Mild, easier to kill off[CR]At the top left is your life level and at the top right is how many nests remain...[CR]TIP: It is best to rush quickly towards a nest and take it out quickly... then take out any queens before they start a new nest... then repeat same strategy on the next nest :)[CR](Current game doesn't have intro or ending)[CR](This game only tests green and yellow)[CR](game is currently non level, levels will be added later)

game.name: micro arranger nx
game.plot: micro arranger nx[CR]Created By desbyc[CR]Here is a little tool to arrange your tracks to build a song. [CR]V1.5[CR]After start, some tracks will place random in some slots. You can remove them by press the „CLEAR“-button. Select your track from 1 to 64 with the turningwheel. Now tap on a cell of one line to place the selected track. The selected track will be played to verify. [CR]Use the touch area in the middle of the screen to swipe left or right. [CR]Press the trash-button (turns red) and tap on a cell to erase. [CR]With the play-button you start your song. [CR]Start will take a while. Keep cool😏. [CR]There are still some bugs, i work on. [CR]You can NOT save your song. [CR]Edit:[CR]New version:[CR]Add my tool to your toollist. [CR]You can now load and save your songs. (Very big thanks to Timo)[CR]After start, you geht prompt to select a soundfile.[CR]Now you can arrange your tracks. [CR]Please work only on copies of your programs.

game.name: SoundPad SoundEdition
game.plot: SoundPad SoundEdition[CR]Created By desbyc[CR]Here is a new editon of my Soundpad.[CR]Build your own sounds with the Sound Composer.[CR]Now you can select your favorit sounds (inst 0-15) and play it with the 4 pads.[CR]You can press the record-button (the round) and every touch on the pads will be recorded.[CR]Press the record-button again and the record will stop.[CR]Now press play (the triangle) and your records will be played.[CR]During the recording you can change the sound and play it and it will be recorded.[CR]During the recording you can change the pitch of the sound, play it and it will be recorded.[CR]You can mute the voice by pressing the button with the speaker.[CR]You can clear the voic by pressing the del-button.[CR]Right from play- and record-button you find the speed-controll.[CR]Any questions?[CR]Play arround with it and you will have fun. I prommise;-).[CR]Sounds from 0 to 9 are filled.[CR]PS: You can NOT save your recordings!!! If you end the program, your pattern get lost.[CR]V2.0[CR]New Version:[CR]Now you have a button for settings (SET).[CR]A new screen loads with settings:[CR]Volume for each voice[CR]Patternlength for each voice[CR]Max_patternlength for all voices[CR]There are some things buggy, but i think it is good enough for use;-).

The box on the left side of the screen will show you, in first person what the castle knight sees, from rooms to demons. game.name: Boulder Dash NX
game.plot: Boulder Dash NX[CR]Created By desbyc[CR]Hi, today i release the final version of my interpretation of Boulder Dash, Boulder Dash NX:-).[CR]It was a lot of work an i have to thank Timo for much help and tips. Thank you.[CR]Also thanks to:[CR]\- https://codeincomplete.com/posts/boulderdash-game-logic/[CR]\- https://gist.github.com/sinewalker/b7019b2e8ecb4b1a0de79f8c9a7d4b28[CR]The Game:[CR]Your goal is to collect all diamonds. You can walk up, down, left and right, but not diagonal. Sometimes the diamonds are under rocks and you have to put the rocks away. You can do that by pushing them left or right if no other rocks, diamonds or dirt is behind them. If you walk under a rock, nothing happens, but if a rock or a diamond falls on you, you die and you have to repeat the cave. There is no life to lose:-).[CR]The butterflies want to kill you, avoid to touch them. After collected all diamonds the cave is complete and you get the next. You have to complete 6 caves.[CR]Sometimes you get stuck between the rocks or you cant reach all diamonds.[CR]Then press Left+A for reboot the cave.[CR]If you want to restart the whole game press Left+B.[CR]I tested all caves very intensive and all are solvable. Believe me.[CR]The best way to play is to use a gamepad. With build in pad, it is difficult.[CR]You can build you own caves. Look at my caves and you see how to build one.[CR]There are some rules for caves.[CR]Make a border withe char 64.[CR]Leave line 0 free for statistics.[CR]Place at least one diamond (inside the border) with char 32.[CR]Place one player-start-point (inside the border) with char 66.[CR]All other object are optional.[CR]To test your cave, change the value of STARTLEVEL at the beginn of the code.[CR]E.G.: to reach cave 6, STARTLEVEL has to be 5.[CR]Questions.....ask me:-)[CR]Have fun.[CR]This version is for the latest NX-version.[CR]I will post a second version without sound.

Each character has his own b attack. Before you can use your b attack you need to first hit ten successful a attacks. For more information look at the “how to play” manual in the settings. If you have trouble copying it because the code is too long you can copy it in different bits. Also thanks to Timo for helping fix the menu.

game.name: Snakes in the Grass 0.4
game.plot: Snakes in the Grass game[CR]Created By was8bit[CR](NX core 0.11)[CR]Find the snakes in the Grass...[CR]This is a puzzle.... toggle the gameboard buttons to set them as [CR]Grass (not sure)[CR]Null (empty, no snake)[CR]Check (snake)[CR]There are the following snakes:[CR]1 of length 4[CR]2 of length 3[CR]3 of length 2[CR]Rule 1: no snakes can touch each other, this means there is NO other snake in any space around a known snake[CR]Rule 2: the sum of spaces with part of a snake have the total on the top of the column or to the left of the row...[CR]HINT: it's OK to hit the QUESTION MARK button in the upper left corner... it will try to reveal a clue where there is grass... otherwise it tries its best ...[CR]TO WIN: correctly tag all unexposed spaces as: clear (null) or snake (checkmark)... you know you've won when all snakes are exposed in their full color, and a victory chord is played... [CR]Uses latest TestFlight version...

game.name: Message File Pro 1.2 (TOOL)
game.plot: BULK DATA STORAGE (TOOL)[CR]Created By was8bit[CR](NX core 0.11)[CR]This is a fully functioning TOOL, which you need to add to your tool list [CR]ALSO you will need a copy of the DEMO by the same name as it includes the variable set up and subroutine you'll need to use the data file in your game :)[CR]TAP anywhere in the text area to enter the EDIT mode [CR]While in edit mode, hit RETURN or ENTER to exit back out [CR]You can use BACKSPACE, and you may overwrite any existing text [CR]*NOTE* for simple text needs its best to use LowRes string variables, and for small volumes load them with DATA statements... this TOOL has a maximum capacity for 818 lines, for a maximum of 16KB of data, which is half the space allowed for your entire file memory! This then should only be used if you have intensive storylines, and or a ton of game commentary.

game.name: Demo 0.6
game.plot: Mario Parallax Demo[CR]Created By Timo[CR]This is just a scrolling screen and you can move and jump. No actual game. By using both BGs, cell/sprite priorities and raster interrupts, it looks almost 3D and has a water effect.[CR]This is the first demo I programmed for LowRes NX to check the graphics system. It was originally written in C and later ported to BASIC.
